body:
Hi,

I am running a simple EP (v8.3) simulation with ideal air loads and noticed that I was getting some latent cooling loads even though I have not set any humidity limits in the EPzonethresholds component.

Looking at the IDF, I noticed that all humidity settings under HVACTemplate:Zone:IdealLoadsAirSystem were left blank; which I took to mean no humidity controls were set up. I was wrong! EP was somewhat setting a maximum absolute humidity in the supply air, hence the latent cooling loads I got in the results.

I then went on to try and manually edit the IDF and put 'None' under Dehumidification Control Type. This resolved the issue and my supply air humidity is allowed to fluctuate to saturation (and only then there is some dehumidification)



Although I am not very familiar with coding, looking at the runEnergySimulation component, I think I small change in the code may resolve the issue to make sure that 'None' is specified if humidity limits are not set (see below). Hope this works!







original code

<font color="#008000" size="2"><font color="#008000" size="2">#Humidity Control</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">if</font></font>** <font size="2">zone.humidityMax !=</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">""</font></font><font size="2">: dehumidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">"Humidistat"</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">else</font></font>**<font size="2">: dehumidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">""</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">if</font></font>** <font size="2">zone.humidityMin !=</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">""</font></font><font size="2">: humidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">"Humidistat"</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">else</font></font>**<font size="2">: humidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">""</font></font>



<font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">suggested change</font></font>

<font color="#008000" size="2"><font color="#008000" size="2">#Humidity Control</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">if</font></font>** <font size="2">zone.humidityMax !=</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">""</font></font><font size="2">: dehumidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">"Humidistat"</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">else</font></font>**<font size="2">: dehumidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">"None"</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">if</font></font>** <font size="2">zone.humidityMin !=</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">""</font></font><font size="2">: humidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">"Humidistat"</font></font>

**<font color="#0000FF" size="2"><font color="#0000FF" size="2">else</font></font>**<font size="2">: humidCntrl =</font> <font color="#FF0000" size="2"><font color="#FF0000" size="2">"None"</font></font>
topic: Ideal Air Humidity Control settings missing
